page.title: 13INDUSTRY.
page.content: {QUARRIES OF HARLESTONE} There was at one time numerous quarries,the sandstone,freestone rock being used to construct local buildings.The stone became harder the deeper it lay and contained ferruginous streaks known by locals as the "masons bankrupter" since it wore out tools very quickly.This was a popular stone with northern housewives as they used it for sanding doorsteps(called donkey stones). Near to the Manor House is the site of quarries which date back more than three hundred years(known as the hills and hollows). A disused quarry used as a tip for village refuse is almost full. The only quarry remaining in use is used at present to store materials for motorway maintenance.
